channel.title: Mac VS. PC
channel.description:
I know that alot of people would say mac and alot pc, but you cant compare them, there both good, i have both so i should know, and the reason you cant compare them is because they both do completely different thing. Its like trying to compare a cheeseburger and a towel, it cant be done!!!
I rest my point

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
sersoft:

I know, isn’t ophcrack awesome? Anyway you don’t need a CD like that for macs, you just boot into root user with a simple keyboard shortcut at the mac logo.

I call shenanigans it being that easy. It skips asking for a password?

Also, I used active disk, but there’s definitely a few methods to do that.

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
garthbartin:

I feel that the mac and pc argument could be argued logically and civily, but it appears not many are making an attempt. Things like calling people “mac-haters” or “pc-haters” or fanboys, or being a fanboy, is not in any way contibuting to this thread.

Once again, I challenge mac supporters to give me definite things that make macs better than pc for artistic purposes.

It haz teh pretty yew-eye!

Really, if you’re waiting for an answer to this, you’ll be waiting a while. As far as I know every major image/video/3d/other program is on Windows as well as Mac. They just like to bring up that argument so they don’t feel as ripped off by their over-priced hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
IsolatedPurity:

Can you not read? Or are you just brain dead?

Honestly, I’m not a fan boy of ANY os, I see all there flaws and advantages and if I wasn’t such a gamer, I’d be using Linux probably, That idiot replies to my post “LOL WRONG” with NO evidence or knowledge of any operating system and came running to the defense of MAC even though there is enough PROOF to show that they are not invincible.

Oh and fan boys refuse to use anything but the OS they a fan boy of. (Unless they have no choice.) I bought my laptop which is decent enough to play CoH and some other low demanding games for HALF of the average mac, so if I could get a mac that cheap I’d probably own one.

IsolatedPurity:

WOW, LOL!

Learn to fucking read my post before replying like a smart ass, It might HELP your argument. The fact that Mac represents less than 4% of the worldwide installed OS of computers might explain why there are fewer Mac viruses.

But hey you’re just a Fan boy, so I can expect your reply to be… hmm… “NUHU WINDOWS SUX” Or Wait, you’ll quote CERTAIN parts of my post and produce a error-filled wall of text that I won’t even read.

https://blogs.zdnet.com/security/?p=2917

Oh and an FYI, the very FIRST computer virus was written and successfully inputted into a MAC.

IsolatedPurity:

Honestly, I get sick of seeing Mac’s TV commercials “LOL WINDOWS HAS BILLIONS OF VIRUSES, 3 SECONDS ON THE INTERWEBS GIVES YOU VIRUSES” That’s what they pretty much say, Which is total bull shit. Mac are just as prone to get infected as Windows, the only reason why there are more bugs out there for windows is because Windows is more popular. I installed AVG and I haven’t been infected for years. No problems, nothing.

If you’re stupid enough to fall for the adds like “FREE AV PROGRAM HERE, CLICK HERE AND DOWNLOAD AVPROGRAM.EXE TO I FIX ALL OF YOUR VIRUSES” It doesn’t matter what OS you have, you’re going to get infected and you deserve it!

I’m all for giving Macs and Windows equal opportunities (I’d like to have one of their laptops, but for there price I can get a pure 1337 gaming laptop lol.) And I love DX10 with my 295 so, yeah…

Read your posts, they pretty all yell “NUHU MAC SUX”. So maybe you’re not a fanboy but you’re definitely a Mac-hater, therefore making any of your arguments invalid.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
bob:

Macs SUCK big time. They really do. The first game that I completed on the Macbook was Minerva: Metastasis. The game crashed after every hour of gameplay. That was the longest time that the game would run until crashing. It’s because DirectX does not get along with Mac hardware on a Bootcamped Windows OS. Macs are only good for OpenGL games and those games are all from the 90’s. I have a coworker of mine that has promised to build me a gaming PC. All I have to do is give him the list of parts I want and he goes to price sites to find the websites that have the cheapest parts. After all, I don’t want to play Black Mesa on this MacCrap and have it crash from 5 minutes in the game to an hour. I don’t want to click on the “Would you like to send an error report?” box that comes up with each crash. I want to play Black Mesa without any interruptions. Also I want to play it on Windows 7 Home Premium or Ultimate on a gaming PC instead of Windows XP on my Mac.

:retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
Macs SUCK big time. They really do. The first game that I completed on the Macbook was Minerva: Metastasis. The game crashed after every hour of gameplay. That was the longest time that the game would run until crashing. It’s because DirectX does not get along with Mac hardware on a Bootcamped Windows OS. Macs are only good for OpenGL games and those games are all from the 90’s. I have a coworker of mine that has promised to build me a gaming PC. All I have to do is give him the list of parts I want and he goes to price sites to find the websites that have the cheapest parts. After all, I don’t want to play Black Mesa on this MacCrap and have it crash from 5 minutes in the game to an hour. I don’t want to click on the “Would you like to send an error report?” box that comes up with each crash. I want to play Black Mesa without any interruptions. Also I want to play it on Windows 7 Home Premium or Ultimate on a gaming PC instead of Windows XP on my Mac.

item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
garthbartin:

Lol, agreed. the mac bar provides not much more then a right click or an in program toolbar does. the start menu gives you all your programs, recent programs, recent documents and more. And then you have the right click and in program toolbars for everything the mac bar has.

Um, actually I said “PC owns bitches” because all I have is a PC (and thus, I sound like a fanboy), but that’s cool too.
But fanboy or not, I still side with PC. It all comes down to this: PC has games, Mac does not.

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: IsolatedPurity
item.description:
Level:

Wrong.
Macs are not as prone to get infected, because they have a grand total of 3 ‘viruses’ or so, none of which do much. Windows does not have more bugs because it’s more popular, it’s because they have a lot more people looking for them, it’s a lot more open ended then macs, and because they’re better advertised then the bugs that macs have. If you click on one of those ads while you’re on a mac, you don’t get infected because that ad can’t do shit all to you because you’re on a mac.

Get your facts straight.

WOW, LOL!

Learn to fucking read my post before replying like a smart ass, It might HELP your argument. The fact that Mac represents less than 4% of the worldwide installed OS of computers might explain why there are fewer Mac viruses.

But hey you’re just a Fan boy, so I can expect your reply to be… hmm… “NUHU WINDOWS SUX” Or Wait, you’ll quote CERTAIN parts of my post and produce a error-filled wall of text that I won’t even read.

Security researchers at Symantec recently discovered a group of thousands of Mac OS X computers infected with a trojan horse application embedded in pirated copies of iWork 09.

The infected users had installed the software without scanning it for viruses, no doubt in part because of Apple’s commercials implying that Mac users don’t need to worry about security.

Once the hacker managed to get his malware installed on these zombie Mac computers, the entire group was fully under his control – and he began to use them to attack web sites, but they could be used for other, more nefarious purposes: like sending spam!

https://blogs.zdnet.com/security/?p=2917

SAN FRANCISCO - Benjamin Daines was browsing the Web when he clicked on a series of links that promised pictures of an unreleased update to his computer’s operating system.

Instead, a window opened on the screen and strange commands ran as if the machine was under the control of someone — or something — else. Daines was the victim of a computer virus.

Such headaches are hardly unusual on PCs running Microsoft Corp.’s Windows operating system. Daines, however, was using a Mac — an Apple Computer Inc. machine often touted as being immune to such risks.

Oh and an FYI, the very FIRST computer virus was written and successfully inputted into a MAC.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac VS. PC
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

Give me a second.
(/Looks at the “Start” tab. Sees a Windows logo./)[/SIZE]
PC owns bitches! Fuck the Mac!

Lol, agreed. the mac bar provides not much more then a right click or an in program toolbar does. the start menu gives you all your programs, recent programs, recent documents and more. And then you have the right click and in program toolbars for everything the mac bar has.

Also, any discussion on pcs being inferior due to viruses is completely and utterly irrelevant. If you are an intelligent person who knows at least something about computers and you don’t go picking fights with hackers, you will be able to go years without a virus.

Read full topic
